conclusion: Analyze positions of particles A and B to find when they are farthest apart.
Determine position of particle A from t=0 to t=t0 by integrating velocity.
Position of A: x_A(t) = v_0 * (t^2 / t_0) for t=0 to t=t0.
Determine position of particle A from t=t0 to t=3t0 by integrating velocity.
Position of A: x_A(t) = v_0(t - t_0) + (v_0/4)(t - t_0)^2 for t=t0 to t=3t0.
Determine position of particle A from t=3t0 to t=6t0 with constant velocity 0.
Position of A: x_A(t) = 2v_0 t_0 + (v_0/4)(t - t_0)^2 for t=3t0 to t=6t0.
Determine position of particle B with constant velocity v_0.
Position of B: x_B(t) = v_0 t.
Calculate distance d(t) = |x_A(t) - x_B(t)| to find maximum separation.
Calculate d(t) for t in [0, t0]: d(t) = v_0 t |(t - t_0)/t_0|.
